options.content: improves the chance of recall and makes the performance of a task more resistance to stress and is an important concept of aviation training
is a process which is discouraged in the aviation training as it may lead to “regression” in times of acute stress
is a process in training which is usually adopted in order to pass complicated concepts to a recipient of limited capabilities
is the process whereby information is layered and linked with previously learned facts and is an important tool to improve short-term memory

questions.question:
Environmental capture is:

1. obtaining environmental skills

2. performing a skill in an environment commonly flown in, even if it is incorrect to do so

3. the performance of a skill previously learnt in a different aircraft even f it incorrect to do so

the way behaviour changes in different social situations
With regard to automation of behaviour and the attention mechanism:

options.content: the less behaviour is automated, the less attention is required and the more resources are available
the more behaviour is automated, the more attention is required and the more resources are available
the more behaviour is automated, the more attention is required and the less resources are available
the more behaviour is automated, the less attention is required and the more resources are available

questions.question: Mental models of the world are based on:

A pilot becomes skilled when he/she:

1. trains or practises regularly

2. knows how to manage him/herself

3. possesses all the knowledge associated with his/her aircraft

4. knows how to keep resources in reserve for coping with the unexpected
Mental models are based:

options.content: past experiences and sensory information received

questions.question: Once a mental model is constructed, there is a tendency to give:

options.content: undue weight to information that contradicts the model
equal weight to information that contradicts and confirms the mental model
frequent alterations to the mental model
undue weight to information that confirms the model

questions.question: Motor programmes save resources and therefore attention, however they may result in:

options.content: errors in selecting the correct plan of action

questions.question: Mental rehearsal is useful for:

options.content: only for pilots with a specific level of experience

questions.question:
Which of the following statements are correct?

1. The first information determines how subsequent information will be evaluated

2. If an individual has made up his/her mind, contradictory information may not receive the attention it needs

3. With increasing stress, attention tends to become limited and reduce the flow of information to the central decision maker
When problem solving, what determines the transition from rule-based activities to knowledge-based activities?

options.content: Knowledge of rules that apply for the problem
Unsuitability of known rules for the problem posed
Lack of knowledge of the rules

questions.question:
Which of the following are included in Maslowˋs Hierarchy of Needs:

1. self-fulfilment through expression of capacities and talents

2. self-esteem through self respect

3. safety through avoidance of danger

4. achievement through group efforts

5. self-esteem through a job
When do we change from rule-based behaviour to knowledge-based behaviour?

options.content: When we choose to do so
When we do not know the rules

questions.question: Which of the following can be said to be true?

options.content: Motivation can substitute for a lack of knowledge
Motivation is only a psychological phenomenon
Motivation can lead to trying to attain an unrealistic goal which will cause stress and which will lead to a reduction in performance

questions.question: Very high ambition and drive for success can lead to:
With respect to Maslowˋs Hierarchy of Needs (1943) he expounded that:

options.content: motives lower in the hierarchy are aroused first and must be satisfied first
motives higher in the hierarchy are aroused first and must be satisfied first
motives in the middle of the hierarchy are aroused first and must be satisfied first
any level may be aroused and there is no significance as to which must be satisfied first

questions.question: With respect to the subcutaneous pressure receptors, they sense:

options.content: pressure on the body indicating true vertical

questions.question: A pilot is accustomed to a runway with a width of 27 m and lands on an unfamiliar runway with a width of 42 m. The pilot will tend to:

options.content: fly a too high an approach and overshoot
fly a too low an approach and overshoot
fly a too high an approach and undershoot
fly a too low an approach and undershoot

questions.question: The Gestalt Theory relates to:
When staring at an isolated light at night, the light may appear to:
Illusions that pilots experience in conditions of fog, snow or mist are that:

options.content: objects appear further away than they really are
objects appear closer than they really are
objects appear to move slower than they really do
objects appear to move faster than they really do

questions.question: Cognitive illusions are caused by:

options.content: erroneous mental model resulting from a misinterpretation of sensory inputs

questions.question: What should you do if disorientated at night:
Where are the pressoreceptors located?
The illusion that the aircraft is taxiing too fast can be caused by:

options.content: a unaccustomed high distance of the cockpit from the ground

questions.question: Errors in the judgment of height on an approach are more likely over:
To cure autokinesis:

options.content: first focus on the light with the right eye and then the left
shake the head and turn down the cockpit lights
look at the light out of the corner of your eye
look for other references inside and outside the cockpit and use peripheral vision

questions.question: The seat-of-the-pants sensation emanates from receptors in the:

options.content: muscles and joints sensitive to the movement and position of the body

questions.question: What is the illusion when an aircraft is flying in fog, snow or haze?

options.content: Objects appear to be further away than they actually are
Objects appear to be closer than they actually are
Objects appear to move faster than they actually are
Objects appear to be larger than they actually are

questions.question: What is the normal illusion for a pilot undertaking an approach on an up-sloping runway?
On an approach at night in rain onto a runway with approach lighting it is it not unusual for the approach to appear:
Flying by the “seat of oneˋs pants”:

options.content: gives a feeling of coming up and out of your seat
is not reliable and does not indicate spatial orientation
is reliable and indicates spatial orientation
is not reliable and indicates spatial orientation

questions.question:
Input for orientation is through:

1. eyes

2. utricles and saccules

3. semicircular canals

4. seat-of-the-pants receptors

1. Paradoxic sleep refreshes the brain, memory and body.

2. Paradoxic sleep decreases during the night?

Which is correct?

Which of the following statements are correct? Hypovigilance is increased by:

1. lack of stimulation

2. tiredness

3. monotony

4. stress

1. The effects are worse when travelling from East to West

2. The effects are worse when travelling from West to East

3. Varies little between individuals

4. Varies substantially between individuals

The characteristics of paradoxic sleep are:

1. refreshes body and muscle tone

2. REM

3. decreases during the night

4. brain activity similar to that of being awake

What is the maximum number of sleep “credits” for the normal person?

What would disrupt the biological clock?

1. A night flight from New York to Amsterdam

2. A day flight from Amsterdam to New York

3. A day flight from Amsterdam to Johannesburg

4. A poor nightˋs sleep
What characterizes a self-centred cockpit?

options.content: Autocratic Captain assures a synergistic cockpit
Crew member tends to do their own jobs independently without keeping other informed
A non-synergistic cockpit in which the Captain tends to be authoritarian

questions.question: Attitude is:

options.content: a genetic predisposition to be biased either positively or negatively
How a person responds to another person, situation or organization either positively or negatively

questions.question:
Personality is based on:

1. heredity

2. childhood

3. upbringing

4. experience
During the preflight brief the aircraft commander should:

options.content: delegate all duties to all crew members for the entire flight
emphasize that he/she is in charge
emphasize areas requiring good crew coordination
ensure all points are covered for the flight to avoid repetition in the cockpit

questions.question: Attitude is:

options.content: part of personality and cannot be changed in an adult
a personˋs response to a situation, person or object
stable and cannot be changed in an adult

questions.question:
Leadership qualities should include:

1. a dominant style

2. laissez-faire

3. technical competency

4. good communications

During the cruise, the Captain of an aircraft starts to smoke a cigarette. The copilot is a non-smoker and asks him to stop. The Captain ignores his request saying “Thatˋs your problem”. What should the co-pilot do about the situation?

options.content: He should call one of the cabin crew and ask him/her to arbitrate
He should argue with the Captain pointing out the potential dangers
He must accept his Captainˋs behaviour since it is the Captain who is responsible
He should stop discussion and return to the issue during the debrief at the end of the flight

questions.question:
What characteristics are most frequently and least appropriately displayed by a copilot when under command of a highly autocratic Captain?

1. Self assertion

2. Scapegoat feeling

3. Delayed reactions to observed discrepancies

4. Disengagement
Which of the following statements is correct?

options.content: Attitudes do not change in the long term
Behaviour is the outward result of personality and attitude
Attitude is the outward result of behaviour and personality

questions.question:
Which of the following statements regarding interpersonal interactions are correct?

1. If the sender believes that the receiver is competent, he/she tends to reduce the verbal redundancy of his/her sentence

2. If the interlocutor is of non-native tongue, the sender will use more difficult words so as to optimise understanding

3. If the sender believes that the receiver does not understand, he/she will simplify the contents of the sentence

4. By making checklists simpler, for crews that know each other, this is the root cause of interpersonal conflict
Metacommunications:

options.content: are of no importance in the cockpit

questions.question: What is not a useful element of good feedback?
What constitutes effective communications?

options.content: Speaking in a variety of mother tongues
Using different context which would be understood by the receiver
Using commonly understood context, language and metacommunications

questions.question: What is the main purpose of preflight briefings?

options.content: To allow the Captain to assert his/her authority
To allow individual crew member to prepare their own responses to likely or problematic events
They form general information about the flight but they contain no specific reference to likely or problematic events
They form information about the flight and allocate responsibilities and reactions to likely or problematic events

questions.question: Pilots should:

options.content: have a good command of the English language
have at least a limited English vocabulary
be able to understand key words and phases only since these are sufficient to sufficiently impart meaning
be able to have a command of a local language since this is sufficient and legal in an emergency

questions.question:
To resolve conflict you should:

1. actively listen

2. talk on an emotional level

3. be aware of prejudice

4. the leader should not offer his/her thoughts at the start
Which of the following elements of communications is most likely to lead to misunderstanding?

Choose is/are the correct statement/s with regards to communications:

if the transmitter considers the recipient competent, he/she cuts down the verbal redundancy of sentences

2. if the transmitter considers the recipient incompetent, sentences tend to be simplified

3. if the interlocutor is a non-native language, the transmitter will emphasize points by using more complicated sentences to optimize understanding

4. crew who know each other well tend to simplify checklists when conflict takes place
In communication which element shows that information has been received and understood?
With regards to anticipation, which of the following would most likely to result in the occurrence of a hazardous situation?

options.content: Mishearing the contents of an air traffic controllerˋs non-standard clearance when a standard procedure was anticipated
Anticipation of a longer flight time than expected

questions.question:
Which of the following represent a solution to conflict?

1. Seeking arbitration

2. Active listening

3. Moving the conversation onto an emotional level

4. Awareness of cultural differences
Which of the following statements are correct with reference to automation?

options.content: Enables the pilot to respond to unusual situations better since there is no need to monitor automatics
Reduces pilotˋs attention since they can be out of the loop

questions.question: Co-action is a form of cooperation that involves:

options.content: working in parallel towards a common goal
working in parallel towards separate goals

questions.question:
A latent error:

1. will show itself in time

2. will not be foreseen by programmers

3. lies dormant

4. only becomes apparent under certain conditions

5. will easily be recognized by operators
Murphyˋs Law states that:

options.content: even if a system can be designed correctly, it will always be misused
if a system can be operated incorrectly, sooner or later it will be
if a system can be operated incorrectly it should be guarded
if a system can be operated incorrectly it should be backed up by a second system

questions.question: The alerting system for an important system failure should be:

options.content: a flashing visual signal - preferably red
a steady visual signal - preferably red

questions.question: Between which components of the SHELL Concept would create a mismatch when reading a 3 point altimeter?
The introduction of automation and improvements in glass cockpit designs:

options.content: can sometimes be detrimental to performance as some systems provide poor quality feedback to pilots
give better communications in the cockpit, as pilots have more time to communicate
improves man/machine interface due to artificial intelligence in modern FMS
almost completely remove the need to communicate with ATC

questions.question: What would be the priority aim in the design of man/machine interface in combating the occurrence of human error?

options.content: To minimize the consequences of the appearance or non-appearance of errors with respect to safety
To systematically analyse the occurrences of errors to improve the future design of systems and ergonomics
To generate clear warnings and alerts

questions.question: Between which stage will a human error be induced in the interface of a warning system?
Checklists are most important when:

options.content: flying an aircraft which you have flown many times before
flying an aircraft with which you are not familiar and when under stress
flying an aircraft in which you are current

questions.question: Errors resulting from a bad indexing system in a checklist or manual are related to a mismatch between:

Which of the following are performed better by man than machine?

1. Waiting for an infrequent phenomenon

2. Detection of unusual conditions such as smell or noise

3. Qualitative decision making

4. Monitoring of systems
SOPs in the cockpit must:

options.content: only be tailored to the type of aircraft regardless of current MCC procedures
follow implicitly the manufacturerˋs suggestions and not reflect the operatorˋs cockpit procedures
be shared by the members of the crew and modified/updated so as to maintain as much synergy as possible
be tailored to the individual pilotˋs needs and requirements

questions.question: The term “complacency” means:

options.content: to query and double-check possible solutions
synergy between the co-pilot and the Commander emanating from CRM procedures
physiological problems resulting from the fear of flying
unjustified self-confidence resulting in careless negligence

questions.question: One of the negative aspects of automation is:

options.content: it can lead to complacency of the aircrew
pilots tend to be overloaded when trying to monitor the equipment
crews become less experienced because the ease of control
pilots tend to disregard the equipment

questions.question: With reference to decision making, it is:

options.content: conscious and voluntary after assessing the options

questions.question: An efficient flight deck crew is one which:

options.content: respect each otherˋs decision and views
respect each otherˋs political and religious persuasions

questions.question: Confirmation bias of the decision-making process is:

options.content: to ignore information which indicates that a hypothesis or decision is poor
not to seek information which confirms the decision
not to look for information which would reassure the correct decision
to look for facts that confirm expectations before making a decision
